meanings.definition: The place where a dead body is buried.
meanings.sent1: The family visited the gravesites of their ancestors.
meanings.sent2: The cemetery has many gravesites with beautiful headstones.
meanings.sent3: During the ghost tour, they joked about the gravesites being haunted.
meanings.sent4: The rows of gravesites stretched out like a silent city of the deceased.
meanings.sent5: The sun set behind the gravesites, casting long shadows over the tombstones.

meanings.sent1: She placed fresh flowers at the gravesites of her loved ones.
meanings.sent2: The map showed the exact gravesites of historical figures in the cemetery.
meanings.sent3: The treasure hunters mistakenly thought the gravesites held hidden riches.
meanings.sent4: The gravesites in the old churchyard were overgrown with ivy, blending into nature.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight illuminated the gravesites, creating an eerie glow in the darkness.
